Reviews.Title: Be aware, be informed
Reviews.Author: Scott B
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the picture on this TV; with adjustments to your specific likes, it's very good.  It took me about a day to find the right settings because I needed to see it in different light, day and night etc.  Items or people in focus are crystal clear, while the background can seem a little grainy if you focus on it.Sound; Boy this was an odd set up.  For the built in speakers, they're pretty good.  Since I live in a townhouse, back facing speakers are not a good idea, since my neighbors can hear as well as I can.  (This applies to bedroom walls too if you mount a TV on opposing walls)  I use a sound bar that projects the sound into our living room and my neighbors hear NOTHING.  That said, this TV has only a single audio coaxial output and there are not many sound systems where that's compatible.  The solution,since we have HD cable, was to wire the sound from the cable box directly to the sound bar (very very simple once I figured that out).  I also had to do the same from our DVD player since we did not want the sound to go through the TV when we watched movies.  Then we simply shut the sound off on the TV by turning the volume all the way down.  Unlike other TVs there is no option to shut off the built in speakers, and pressing "mute" on the remote leaves an icon on the screen.The remote;  works very well, but if you use a universal or cable remote it's difficult if not impossible to find a code for this brand.  40 minutes of a search on the remote has yet to reveal a code that works.  I'll keep trying.The stand: Incredibly well built and easy to attach.  Just the base to connect as the trunk or stem is connected right out of the box.The outer frame around the screen is small and not a distraction.  When the TV is off the power light is very bright.  The on-unit controls are on the side on the bottom right.The TV is very thin and for its' size, very lightweight.  31.5 pounds including the box.Overall, for the money, it's well worth it.  I'd like better audio out connections and a remote code, but the picture and price are well worth the buy.Updated 11/6/13:  Found the remote codes!  I have Bright House Networks so the code 0178 worked, but here's what I found from the manufacturer:DIRECTV - 10178Time Warner Cable - 0178Philips - 0002Comcast - 11864 or 10178Cox Communications - 0178Atlas DVR Device URC - 0178Bell Remotes & Dish Network - 505, 506, 516, 523, 526, 566, 573, 612, 627, 647, 652, 653, 654, 655, 656, 658, 659, 664, 665, 667, 669, 670, 679, 680, 704, 717, 730, 738

Reviews.Title: Great picture, Skimpy features - Missing Composite Cable Inputs
Reviews.Author: B. Franklin "Breklin"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit apprehensive when adding this item to my cart. I had done a lot of research on the TV and read every review on every website selling it as I could. I found that they use Samsung parts and Yamaha audio components, making the decision a little easier.The TV was delivered in just under 48 hours from order time and it appeared to be packed pretty well in it's manufacturer's box. Unpacking and setting up was a breeze. The only complaint I had at this point was that the base went on horizontally skewed and there was nothing I could do about it. At least it was level.The (3) HDMI ports is perfect for our set up (Digital Cable box, Blu-ray and Apple TV). There are component video inputs but no composite so our Wii would need an adapter which I was able to find on Amazon for about $7.I turned it on and programmed our cable remote with the codes from Seiki's site. Everything seemed to be going quite well.The picture quality is excellent. The blacks are very black and there were no bad pixels. The color cast tends toward the blue side and there are no RGB customization settings but I figured as much with this being a lower end TV.You have Standard, Movie and User profiles for your audio and video settings. In these you can choose color temperature sub-settings. I found "None" or "Warm" to give the best color rendition. I messed with "User" a bit but will come back to it when I have time to properly calibrate it.Overall, I think this was a solid purchase. The audio is good, not great but I'm going to be installing a sound bar soon so that doesn't really matter to me right now. Movies look great. HD Cable needs some more calibration but I am thinking that might be the cable box. It's just a little too blue and violets are very, well, violet.I'd recommend this for $339 any day.

Reviews.Title: A steal at this price
Reviews.Author: jeffliu
Reviews.Content: Unlike the other reviewer, I have had no issues with pixelation on the screen. I am primarily using this screen for xbox and as a movie screen for my computer, and it has had no trouble displaying 1080p media at the appropriate resolution. Setup is quick, and the screen is incredibly light for its size, so it is very easy to mount onto a wall bracket if you so desire.There is a bit of backlight bleed in one of the corners of the screen, and it is most noticeable in low light settings. The TV comes with a couple number of preset color profiles, but I'd recommend calibrating the display to your preferences and your room.All in all, I think you'd be hard pressed to find another 40" 1080p TV at this time for this cheap.

Reviews.Title: The Lightning Deal of the Year 50" LED HDTV for $229 by Seiki
Reviews.Author: Corey H.
Reviews.Content: The Seiki SE50FY10 50-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV is a killer deal!Not only is it lightweight, low-cost and has enough connections audio/video wise to support your needs, this monitor has an absolutely amazing picture! For starters I am a filmmaker/photographer and tech enthusiast. Quality is of the utmost importance to me, I purchased this TV on Wednesday November 27th, 2013 for $229 as a LIGHTNING DEAL. It was the most sought after deal being offered this year and I was lucky enough to get one! My plan was to use this in my living room to view my finished work and watch/play high definition content: Blu-rays, YouTube, Netflix, Gaming, etc.INITIAL SETUP:I own an Early 2013 Retina Macbook Pro which I hooked up to this TV using an HDMI cable. It scaled perfectly through the menu setting "Just Scan" without cutting off any of the borders and displayed a beautiful, bright and sharp image after some minor tweaking at 1080p 60Hz. The menu has plenty of adjustable features in the audio, video, functionality department. It is not a SMART TV so it does not have any WiFi or Bluetooth functionality it's USB port WORKS with Google Chromecast!Pros:Thin, sleek glossy finish along the borders and the base for the TV Stand. Super thin. GREAT SOUND. I'd offer is a B+ this TV is LOUD!! it's probably twice as loud and much better sounding than the RCA 40" speaker bar I bought that I am now returning. There are plenty of adjustable features from color temp, dynamic light control, to audio bass/treble/surround sound. (3) HDMI 1.3 ports, VGA, PC Audio port, Component inputs. L - R Audio inputs and USB input works with Google Chromecast! This TV is wall mountable! I honestly would have paid $500 for this TV which retails for $699 on average and jumps from $500 - $575 on Amazon.Cons:The stand is extremely low quality probably the worst I have ever seen. It is held to the stem of the TV by (6) phillips screws and the TV shakes violently from a simple tap. LED TV's (this being my first) are extremely fragile. No SMART TV features but at a lower than $600 price range and a 50" size why would you expect to get those features? Not really a CON. That's all!OVERALL: 5/5 Stars absolutely no defects or complaints, amazing packaging TV is flawless and massive, super fast response time, set-up is easy, plenty of input options for AUDIO/VIDEO as well as adjustability through the menu system. I was super impressed with the picture quality and highly recommend this TV to anyone looking for a 50" LED under $600. GET IT!! You will be pleasantly surprised and satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Great tv, all my research paid off
Reviews.Author: Alyssa
Reviews.Content: I had my flat screen tv go out in my living room unexpectedly. I looked up tvs on the internet for weeks before finally rolling the dice on this Seiki. Boom, it paid off. This thing is a great tv. Perfect picture, sound is very loud and clear although I plan on getting a surround sound. Programmed easily to my dtv box and smart blu ray player. This is the cheapest big screen on the market with the best picture. I am sold on Seikis now. Although Sanyo also makes a great 50".

Reviews.Title: 50" LED TV & 1080p - it is what it is.
Reviews.Author: Aaron Ray
Reviews.Content: Officially my first black friday purchase on Amazon! 50" LED TV w/ 1080p picture for only $229.. you can't beat that!I ordered it on Wednesday evening (pretty much Thankgiving eve) and it got here on Saturday morning. I was a bit... not particularly worried, but let's say skeptical of the brand "Seiki". I've never heard of it, but it actually turned out to be really nice.PRO's & CON'sPROS:+Really nice picture quality (1080p)+Quick responsiveness on the remote control+1 Year guarantee+Thin bezels+Volume gets really highCONS:-Remote is "basic" - not like one you would get w/ Samsung but it gets the job done-Interface (Menu) - not as pretty as a Samsung's-Service-only USB port; but it DOES work w/ Google ChromecastSummary:I was looking to just get a big screen TV with 1080p picture, and that's what it is. It does what it's supposed to do. Simple as that. Currently got the Chromecast hooked up to it and the picture quality of 1080p is as good as any other top brand of TV out there.

Reviews.Title: Seiki makes a great TV at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: Seiki Digital 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV is a great TV at a great price.  This Seiki Digital TV has an amazing picture and is under 20 pounds.  The user menu has alot of features that allows you to change the contrast and brightness as most TV do, but TV also  has a sleep timer so that it will turn itself off if you are like me and fall asleep while watching TV.The TV has all the connections you will ever need and more.  The TV also has good built-in speakers produce high-quality, crisp and clear audio stereo sound, and even has a powered by high-quality amplifier.This TV is a great Christmas gift and I would definitely recommend it.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: What a GREAT Value!
Reviews.Author: Kitty...
Reviews.Content: We are thrilled with this purchase. Cannot believe we got a LED TV with a 40-inch screen that has such a great pictures for this awesome price. What a GREAT value. We have had it for a month now and cannot say anything poor about it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV very happy
Reviews.Author: Eddie T houston
Reviews.Content: Bought it during the Amazon black Friday event or early Cyber Event. Was shipped to home with in two days. Had to pick it up from FedEx, due to the fact that the tracking said it would be delivered at 4:30 pm but it was delivered at 11:45 am which I was not happy about because I planned my whole day around the tracking information.....  Anyways the box was beat up but the tv was just fine. Set up was easy plug and play. I have Direct TV with a Vizio tv (which the Seiki replaced) and the remote worked right away awesome! The picture is little bright to me, contrast is ok, watched Alabama VS Auburn and it was a nice picture and for $250 GREAT BUY!

Reviews.Title: horrid customer service
Reviews.Author: soccerdad
Reviews.Content: Received a 42" Seiki as a gift. Picture is adequate, price is obviously good.  After about 2 months the remote ceased to function.  After emails to customer service that went unanswered I called.  Received a replacement in the mail.  It was the wrong remote.  Soldiered on without the remote. After 4 more months the tv quit working.  Do not buy this brand because of the customer service, unless you enjoy 45 minute to an hour wait times to talk to a person.  And then even when you do get a person and think you have it all squared away, you don't.  I have been waiting for 2 weeks now for them to send me the tracking number and after my 5th or 6th agonizing call to customer service i find out that it is still waiting for ups to pick it up.  Just do not put yourself in this position.  Purchase a different brand.

Reviews.Title: REMINDER! ENJOY YOUR NEW TV! HELP FOR DIGITAL CODE ISSUE
Reviews.Author: D. Townsend "atruesoldier"
Reviews.Content: People located in cold areas. remember to let your tv warm up before powering on for first time. Your tv may be very cold when it arrives. Dont risk damaging your product before you get to enjoy it. l tell my customers this all the time when delivering in the cold months. Other than that GREAT TV.UPDATE 12/11/2013I know many people are searching for the QAM digital tuner code. This code I got is 31415. I know it works on SEIKI SE46FY10 and the 50 inch. I also read that 00000 code is default.  I have not tried this code but I know 31415 works.  I hope this helps those still waiting in the reply email from Seiki.

Reviews.Title: Tv capable of improved picture quality after many adjustments but overall picture quality is inferior.
Reviews.Author: Barrett Withers
Reviews.Content: I waited three weeks to receive this tv. And what a disappointment it was. There is no backlight control on the video portion of the main menu. Therefore the picture always looks too bright and the colors a bit washed out. I tried turning off the dynamic luminance control which helped a little bit.No RGB control. So this tv at times shows a picture that has too much of a blue or green hue at times. No way to adjust it. Blacks are not deep at all. Picture itself appears grainy even after increasing the sharpness settings.This TV picture is just plain "off". You can see the colors are never right, there is always an imbalance of red, green, or blue. Grainy detail in background. And washed out screen overall due too much backlight.These picture quality problems might have been fixed if their proper adjustment options are available. However you will not have access to fix them since you can not make any adjustments to the backlight and RGB levels.This TV has inferior picture quality to my Sceptre 37" TV and my Insignia 39" tv and they are no name brand tv's as well. Please do yourself a favor and look elsewhere if you are looking for a tv with at least "good" picture quality. This TV does not meet that requirement. I've chose to return this TV.Update: After doing some research online, I found if you go to the main menu and press four digits 0000 it will take you into a second menu which allows you to adjust the backlight under "other settings" and you can also adjust the RGB levels under the "color temperature" option. I'm going to try to do some further calibrating before I decide if I am going to return it or not.Update #2: I found another option in the secondary options menu found with code 0000 on the main menu. You go to other options, then video curve this option allows you to make adjustments to the high level of contrast and brightness levels this TV comes with out of the box which causes the washed out picture effect. After decreasing the factory settings for brightness and contrast under Video curve option this TV's picture finally came alive.Contrast pops against a darker background now. No more washed out background. Brightness level is now balanced so TV does not have the gray hazy effect it originally had out of the box.This Tv has good potential. But you have to show alot of patience with adjustments. My main gripe with this TV is all of the adjustment options should have been readily available in the main menu. But alas, if you press OOOO on the main menu, you will have access to all the additional adjustment options you need to get a great picture out of this Tv.Update #3 This TV still shows a grainy picture no matter how high I adjust the sharpness settings. I find myself having to put on my glasses just to watch it which I have never had to do with any other TV. TV can show a good picture at times but the blacks just are not deep. Nightime picture looks grey and washed out. TV's contrast appears dull not matter what the setting. TV has the lowest contrast ratio of any 40" LED TV I've looked at. I've decided to return this TV last week and I since purchased a Sharp 40" LED tv. So my journey continues. If the Sharp does not work out I will just pay up and get a Samsung 40" LED Tv which I know has superior picture quality albeit at a inflated price. Hope this honest review helps everyone who reads the review section. Have a blessed day.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional TV for an Exceptional Price!
Reviews.Author: Raymo
Reviews.Content: So far I am very impressed with the quality and performance of this television. The picture is sharp and clear, the colors are bold and vibrant. Set-up was easy as the programming did most of the work setting up the channels. It has 3 HDMI ports and a head phone jack amongst others. I cut the cable cord months ago and went with an antenna to capture the local channels (27 for FREE) and I am impressed with the over the air picture quality I am receiving. I connected a blue ray player, slipped in a couple of different movies to check the video output and the picture far exceeded my expectations. The sound is good, not Bose, but good and no problem pushing out the volume.  This is a very, very good television for an exceptional price and you don't have to wait in a line to buy it as it is delivered right to your door... I would recommend this TV to my friends and family without hesitation

Reviews.Title: A High Quality Tv for everyone!!
Reviews.Author: Keith Lartigue
Reviews.Content: I bought this Tv 4 hours ago and before I left the store I asked the supervisor to open and test the tv before I took it home. I was so nervous that I bought a piece of junk $250 refurbished LED TV with the name SEIKI only to take it home and then return it...Only the 24inch was being displayed, not the one I bought.I took it home a hooked up my PS3 to it and let me tell you.THIS TV ROCKS!!!!!!!!!!!!!I have never seen my PS3 so vivid!!! Brilliant Colors!! I then hooked my laptop to it on 1980x1020 and it was sharp!! The only thing I didn't like about the TV was the sound doesn't get very loud, but who cares I only paid $268 with tax..I would still pay $300 for this TV if I bought it on amazon.SEIKI makes it possible for people like me to afford a tv like this. THANK YOU!!!!

Reviews.Title: This Television Rocks!!!!
Reviews.Author: Catfish
Reviews.Content: For people on a Budget, this television rocks.  I am surprised I have not heard of this brand before.  Look as clear as the LG, Samsung and other brands we looked at but at nearly half the price.  60 HZ, but this is fine for the human eyes.  Don't get hung up on that number.  It's just a marketing tool.

Reviews.Title: Crisp picture, fast assembly
Reviews.Author: Marcus Twin
Reviews.Content: Was skeptical of this unit given the low price.  turned out to be fine. quick start guide is great for quick assembly, although the glass plate base was a surprise.  nice picture and sound.  updated a couple weeks after first purchase: ordered  a second one for another room!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding picture, that's what counts! (50 inch model)
Reviews.Author: John J. Stucko
Reviews.Content: I simply have to give it five stars. Granted, I just received it today so I will update if necessary. I was one of the lucky few who managed to snag this for $229 during Black Friday deals week. Keep in mind, this review is for the 50 inch model; I don't understand why amazon doesn't separate the reviews, they are different products after all. Anyway, this isn't a Samsung or a Vizio, but seriously who cares? This thing looks absolutely incredible. The colors just pop out they are so vibrant, and it's nice and bright. The whites are really white, and the blacks are really black. I seriously feel like I legally stole this thing.If I had one complaint, it would be the speakers/sound. They are pretty tinny sounding, but lets be honest, NO TV has great built in sound, that's why we have surround systems and sound bars, hence I will not be deducting any stars for this.The item arrived in very good packaging, the TV was flawless inside. Setup, contrary to one or two other reviewers opinions, was as simple as pie. The product included 6 standard Phillips head screws, you simply screw the stand into the bottom of the TV and you are good to go. I connected my cable box, playstation, and my PC via the 3 HDMI inputs and all three worked flawlessly immediately.Seriously I can't say enough about what counts with a TV: the picture quality. It is just outstanding. As I stated earlier, I did get this TV at the outrageous price of $229, so the price will undoubtedly be higher than that. With that being said, I already had a couple friends offer me more than double what I paid for it, lol. Needless to say, I'll be keeping my new TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Suj
Reviews.Content: I have this in my workout room and it is great.  It has a clear picture and works with my universal remote.  You can't beat it for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great for its cost, but poor quality control. QAM Tuner disabled by default.
Reviews.Author: Glenn
Reviews.Content: I picked up the 40" Seiki SE40FH03 on sale for $170 during Amazon's black Friday week. For that price, it is worth it (provided you do not get dead pixels like I did), no questions asked. The picture and the sound are OK. The picture does needs adjusting out of the box, though. I have also already encountered a number of issues that make me question whether the set would be worth it at a higher price:1. No backlight control. Or at least no backlight control without entering the service menu and going to others -> other setting -> backlight (see below), and the TV is very bright by default.2. The QAM tuner (needed for cable without a cable box) is disabled by default! I thought the tuner was broken at first, as the TV can still be set to scan for cable, but it will find nothing by default. I own a Westinghouse set which pulled a similar stunt, but I just had to go to their website to enter the code to enable the tuner in a straightforward manner. I discovered later that the QAM tuner can be enabled in the service menu by going to "others -> other setting -> Cable QAM" (see below). It was downright stupid for Seiki to put the option in a dangerous section of the TV (you do not want to play around in the service menu unless you know what you are doing, as you could brick the TV by hitting a wrong option). Worse, there is NO mention of the disabled tuner in the manual or on the set itself, so I am guessing Amazon will see returns from people claiming the tuner is broken.3. The set is very thick as far as LED sets go. If you want a nice-looking thin set, look elsewhere. It is as thick as my old LCD set. At least its design looks nice from the front.4. The biggest issue: There are several clusters of dead pixels on my screen (at least 30(!) dead pixels altogether, in groups of 5+ pixels together). They are small enough to not be seen at a distance and almost unnoticable while gaming/watching television (except on static images), so I do not want to go through the hassle of returning the set and paying $80+ more for a different one. I am guessing that Seiki has poor quality control (as most lower-end brands do). I would definitely return this if I could get another set this cheap, and I know many that would return the set outright.5. If your set breaks outside of the return period, Seiki's warranty service is terrible (YOU pay freight both ways, etc). I think extended warranties usually are not worth it, but if you pay a higher price for this set it may be worth looking into.6. No smart features, 120hz/240hz, 3D, internet, or anything else. This is a bare-bones 1080p TV. If you want something else, look elsewhere. I did not deduct any stars for this.7. Poor black levels and mediocre sound (but who buys a TV for its speakers?),Service Menu: At your own risk, to enter the service menu, press menu on the included remote. Once it pops up, press 0 four times to enter the service menu; Do NOT adjust settings or enter menus within the service menu if you are unsure of what they do. Most stuff you want to adjust (backlight, tuner, etc) is in the "other" section.One last tip: The TV's glass stand comes with an annoying sticker on it. It does not come off easily at all. I tried and it teared to shreds.

Reviews.Title: Much better.
Reviews.Author: M. Yelloz
Reviews.Content: This would have been a 5 star rating except the tv came with what looks like a fly's leg embedded under the glass directly to the right of the center of the screen. Once I saw it, it's all I can see. Amazon is currently sending me a new one, so we'll see how that works out when it arrives.Otherwise, this is a great tv. Crisp, clear picture. No idea about the audio on account of my surround sound, but there is no optical (Toslink) so you need to get a digital coax cable and then a powered digital coax to Toslink converter and it will work perfectly. Or just get a receiver that has a digital coax in. Three HDMI inputs I use for cable box, Bluray home theater, and Xbox then the VGA input for my HTPC.Make sure you turn it on and put a white background on the whole screen to see if all your pixels are in order before you mount it in your entertainment center.[...]***UPDATE***Second TV came and everything is right with the world. Everything looks perfect. 5 stars for this TV if it cost $340 like it did when I bought it two weeks ago.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but wait  a couple of weeks
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Ouimet "Canuck"
Reviews.Content: Hi, I bought the 46  inch Seiki set last year.  I bought it on CYBER Monday, the Monday after Black Friday.  I paid $348, shipping free.  I got it in about 2 days.  Great Picture ..I bought a refurbished soundbar for $50 from Walmart too.So, if you are wanting to buy a big screen television, don't go out into the crowds on Black Friday...wait until the following Monday and buy it from the safety of your house.  Right after Cyber Monday it went up $100.Good Luck....

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Reilly
Reviews.Content: Overall, quite pleased with this T.V.Pros: good size, price, handsome, easy setup, bright and vibrant(minimal glare during the day despite being in a room that receives harsh sunlight)Cons: slight light bleed on lower corners (90% of this went away within a week), motion blur during frantic movie scenesAlso, sound was better than I expected, currently not using any external speakers/

Reviews.Title: Two Chances No Luck
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd take a chance based on the mixed reviews. First TV arrived on time as scheduled. The unit worked for a month and then started having problems. The screen would go green when changing channels and I'd have to turn it off to clear. The screen then started to have problems when initially turning on the unit. When turned on, the picture would be wavy and I would have to shut down the unit and then restart the tv. Called Amazon Customer Service and they were good in arranging for a replacement unit. Second unit arrived and it worked for about a month and a half then the same problems started occurring. I'm in the process of returning the second unit. The one good experience out of buying this tv is that Amazon Customer Service stood by their promise to take care of the customer.

Reviews.Title: Rediculous Requirements for QAM tuning.....
Reviews.Author: XFS
Reviews.Content: To get QAM channels:Enable QAM tuning in Service Menu:1.  Search for instructions - enter 0000 to enter service menu.Then send e-mail to Tuner Activation <tunerhdtv@gmail.com> with model # in subject line. Code for this model is:We thank you for your purchase.The tuner activation code is 31415.Listed below are all of the remote codes that we have on file.DIRECTV - 10178Time Warner Cable - 0178Philips - 0002Comcast – 11864, 10178, 0060Cox Communications - 0178Atlas DVR Device URC - 0178Bell Remotes & Dish Network - 505, 506, 516, 523, 526, 566, 573, 612, 627, 647, 652, 653, 654, 655, 656, 658, 659, 664, 665, 667, 669, 670, 679, 680, 704, 717, 730, 738ATT U-verse – 1004

Reviews.Title: Well Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Bryan E. Anderson
Reviews.Content: My review will be on both the product itself and the service received post order.The television was ordered and due to my Prime membership I was supposed to receive the package just two days later.  That did not happen and Amazon did a pretty nice job working with me on the issue, issued me a minor credit towards my next purchase, and called me a few days later to ensure I received my shipment and that everything was OK.  That was a nice touch.  Life happens.As for the television - I am very pleased with the purchase.  Out of the box, the picture is excellent, bright, and vivid.  I have not made a single adjustment to the picture and don't really feel it needs it.  The television was purchased primarily as a set for my kids to play video games, watch movies, and for me to occasionally watch sports when/if the other larger television in our home is being used!The sound is a different story and is why I am giving the set only four stars.  The sound is weak, not quite loud enough, but not so horrible I would send the set back.  Going from volume level one to 50 is almost unnoticeable and even turned up almost to the loudest setting is not at all loud by loud standards.  I am considering a sound bar but probably won't buy one.  If you keep the bass turned down in the audio settings, the set sounds OK but not great.Overall, the television really is a steal for the money.  Hands down the best deal I've found for a television of this size in the market today.  I have other name brand flat screens in our home, i.e. Mitsubishi, Vizio, and Samsung, and this television's picture is absolutely on par with those name brands mentioned.And at this price, the risk in purchasing is minimal and time will tell if the internal circuitry is on par with the competition.

Reviews.Title: Amazon doesn't pack tv's for safe shipping
Reviews.Author: Roger Lodge
Reviews.Content: So I was really excited to get a new tv. This one was on sale for $330. I took it out of the box and started attaching the stand. The screws wouldn't go all the way in, leaving the stand loose. I really tried to crank the screws down but they would only go so far. Then I took the plastic wrap off the screen and saw that the screen had cracks in the corner and the center of it was crushed.I shop a lot on Amazon and every item I order is put in a shipping box with extra packing material. This tv was shipped in ONLY it's retail box, which does not suffice when going through Fedex. This tv should've been put in a shipping box when sent to me to survive the throwing & stacking that shipped packages go through.To make matters worse, I got a refund and I can't get this tv again because it now costs $600.When it comes to sensitive electronics such as this, I'm going to a local store. Tv's are shipped to stores on pallets and are less prone to damage while in transit.

Reviews.Title: The SE50FY10 is not perfect, and no low-end set ever will be ... however @ $229 #$%^#@!!!!
Reviews.Author: ProfessionalGamer
Reviews.Content: I am conservative with rating something "perfect" as nothing really is, however, at the Black Friday price point I cannot believe the exceptional value found in this television.Personally, at ~$500 (current Amazon marketplace price) I would go for a low-end LG or Vizio. Nothing against Seiki, but picture quality could be equalled AND you could get a legitimate stand. The stand on this Seiki frankly sucks (wobbles).My TV arrived in the retail box (no double boxing!) and appeared to have been repackaged. On powering it up and feeding it a pure white 1920x1080 image, I noticed 1 dead pixel on outer left edge towards the bottom. The settings out of the box are garbage. Red gain is cranked way too high. Fortunately if you are willing to go into the service mode, you can bump the backlight down (as well as RED GAIN) and achieve much better color accuracy. I listened to the speakers in the TV for a while, they sound above average. Most (including myself) are going to go with audio out to proper speakers.Pro's:  Decent picture  Blu-rays and PS4 look especially crisp, OTA HD looks ok, SD material is passable  I prefer the digital coax connection over optical due to the run to my AV gear (15')  Looks wise, this set looks pretty slick imo  Reasonably thin panel  Wall mountable  Input lag appears to be very low (action games in PS4 felt on par with my 3.5ms BenQ projector).Con's:  The stand is cheap. Even screwed on (6 SCREWS!!) the set still wobbles.  Dialing in colors MANDATES one to go into the service mode due to a lack of settings in the menu  Not everyone can enjoy the bargain us lucky ones got on Black FridayAll in all, I would buy this set again for myself at any price south of $350.

Reviews.Title: Seiki SE46FY10 46-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on thanksgiving, during that time there was about 20 reviews and they were all optimistic with only a couple complaining about dead pixels so i took a chance. OnTrac didn't ship until the following Monday and I got it on Wednesday. During this time there were about 50 reviews and many people were complaining about broken screens and dead pixels so I was worried,When I received my package, OnTrac did a good job, there weren't any punctures or tears in the box, and the TV and contents were all in working condition. No dead pixels, screen cracks or tears, or broken anything... Now I have a 2012 54" 1080p 240Hz LED back-lit Sony Bravia in the living room, but this TV is replacing my older 2009 32" 720p LCD from Costco, so I know what quality looks like.Initial setup was simple and easy, there are a lot of settings to adjust the TV color, brightness, etc. but certain settings are blocked out. Don't know why people are complaining about the remote, it's nice and small compared to most major brands, and doesn't have random buttons you don't need. Compared to my '09 LCD, the picture is great! The colors stand out more and with a little tweaking around, it really stands out. I would compare this TV to other TVs in the $500-$800 price range. The antennae picks up the same amount of channels as my old LCD, and the HD channels look way better, the 1080p really stands out for this size, compared to 720p.I mostly use this TV for gaming and with my computer (I use an HDMI splitter for my computer monitor so I can view stuff on the TV, better than lugging a laptop around.) The quality is great, It's not a $1000+ TV, but honestly it's hard to tell the difference unless you're TRYING to, like I think most other reviewers are doing.Overall, this TV is well worth the money, the picture quality is nice (I would compare it to LG, Samsung, Sharp, etc.), the unit looks sleek and its not that heavy, I use different speakers so I don't know about the sound but even high end units don't sound that well. and If it was still on sale i'd recommend this to any of my friends.If any problems occur, i'll edit my review.

Reviews.Title: $229 for a 50?!
Reviews.Author: Pissed
Reviews.Content: got this for $229 on black friday!picture is clear and shipping was quick with prime!very nice budget tv for the price even without black friday deal

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Horrible Customer Service If Nothing Else.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Thomas
Reviews.Content: This rating may be subject to change, but for now I am pretty thoroughly displeased. I have had this television all of two hours now. The box was a little beat up when it arrived, but nothing too terrible, the TV inside the box looked fine so it appeared that the packaging had done it's job of protecting the television. I set the television up and got it working, the picture was a tiny bit off but nothing that couldn't be adjusted, and then it worked for all of about an hour and a half. Now my television is sitting there with a black screen, even though the blue power light comes on. Now, when I try to get a hold of customer service for Seiki, I can't. The first attempt at calling them, I got a recording that said the customer service was experiencing a high call volume and I would have to hold. I did, for about 30 minutes, and then for some reason I was directed to an answering machine that just said to leave a message. I have no idea who I was leaving a message with, but I did. When I try to call back, now their customer service just goes straight to that message.As an addendum: Amazon's technical department was awesome and tried to troubleshoot what they could. When they couldn't get the TV to work either, they determined it must be a defective model and are shipping out a new one, so Amazon has done wonderfully, but I will leave my review about the quality of the TV (and Seiki's customer service, who still hasn't called back several hours later) until the new one arrives and works, you know, for more than an hour.A further addendum: Amazon was awesome, they made it easy to return the other TV, and the replacement arrived quickly. Thus far the replacement has worked, though it's only been a month so I'm still wary. The bad part is that Seiki customer service never called back or contacted me in any way, so I don't hold my breath that should anything go wrong, I'll get it resolved. I've upped my rating to a wary three stars, but if the TV holds up I might change it to four stars.

Reviews.Title: 46" Yay!!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Lopez "El Conquistador"
Reviews.Content: 46" Arrived real quick! Works great for the price - can't beat $339 flat! I'm happy, really hope this will last a long time to come!! Only wish there was more video input options for older dvd players, but still a good buy for me.

Reviews.Title: Good for the Price
Reviews.Author: James D Yowell Jr.
Reviews.Content: Good for the price.  For a 46" television I cannot complain about the price it goes in my bedroom and everything works fine.  I got it because it was inexpensive, bare bones with HDMI inputs and I needed to put my Google Chromecast to some use.  I have a couple of complaints however.  Why did I need to call Seiki customer service in order to "unlock" the tuner so that it would pick up my cable stations?  Why then did I have to send an email with the model number to a gmail address in order to get the code to unlock the tuner so that it would find my cable stations?  I must say that this annoyed me a little bit.  I have never had this experience with any other television I have ever purchased.  On the bright side, the process wasted only about 45 minutes of my time, about an half hour to determine I wasn't doing anything wrong, and 15 minutes to call and get the code.  The television now works great and only cost about $350 bucks (currently the price of many much smaller flat screens at Wal-Mart).  I recommend, as long as you realize you might have to go through the setup and call Seiki to get the email address to get the unlock code.  Heck, even if you don't I would go ahead and do it in case you need it in the future.  In addition, they also send you remote control codes with the email.

Reviews.Title: Best Television For The Price
Reviews.Author: Jacob L.
Reviews.Content: Ordered this three days ago and got it yesterday! Shipping was super quick and I only chose the standard free shipping. The expected delivery date was on point. Out of the box the picture quality is one that goes head to head with LG, or Sony LED Tv's as well. In all honesty, not because of the price, but because of the picture, I really recommend this television. It's got a super slim, sleek design to it, the remote is a perfect size because it's not too big or too small and all the buttons and the back ports are easily accessible. I use this for video games and movies and the sound coming out of the box is good as well. Anyone looking for that perfect size and quality in a television, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Skeptical about the brand
Reviews.Author: TechDude
Reviews.Content: I am a samsung man but since my old tv went out and money is tight, I decided to go with a no-name brand tv. $380 for a 46" tv was worth the gamble as any equivalent samsung tv would be double the price. To my surprise, the tv delivers a nice crisp clear picture. Sure the picture isn't quite as nice as a samsung tv but it is not far behind. Colors are vibrant. What the tv lacks is a nice menu with lots of options to change the appearance of the display and energy saving modes but for the price cannot complain. The remote control even resembles that of a samsung remote. One thing that I didn't like was that changing channels takes an extra second compared to the samsung tv's. For some that might not be an issue but again for the price, this is a great tv

Reviews.Title: Seiki Woohooo !!
Reviews.Author: B H
Reviews.Content: Picture was great no pixels out arrived on time and undamaged in original packagin i will buy from again thanks. I was a bit skeptical at the brand but was more than pleased sound could be a little better but I normally am using headphones or ear buds with my ps4 ne way so it dosnt really affect me

Reviews.Title: Great TV For the Price
Reviews.Author: Centaurdb
Reviews.Content: I've had this for a couple months now and I love it.  The picture is great and for the price, you really can't go wrong.  I don't have it hooked up to a sound system and find that the speakers are fine for my use.  I would recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive LED HDTV.

Reviews.Title: 2nd one working perfectly
Reviews.Author: SzTexas
Reviews.Content: First one delivered had bad,pixels.  2nd one wasn't delivered for several weeks but has worked flawlessly. Remote has small buttons so we purchased a different one for our elderly user with poor eyesight.

Reviews.Title: Customer service is crap.
Reviews.Author: R. E. Evans
Reviews.Content: First I had to discover the unlock code (0000) on my own, their customer service had no clue what I was asking about.Second, their customer service claimed it didn't have a QAM tuner...it did.Third, the access code for the QAM receiver is 31415 //  then scan for channels and you'll get HD as well as all cable channels.It's freaking STUPID to sell an HDTV, and not have the ability to see HDTV, without two "secret" codes the manufacturer cannot supply. Spend a little more money and get an HDTV without the "surprises" and REAL customer service.

Reviews.Title: Really happy
Reviews.Author: Michael Meisner
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv prior to Christmas, as a gift for myself. I didn't want to spend a lot of money, but wanted something substantially bigger than my 32" flatscreen. This fit the bill (literally and figuratively) perfectly. The colors are crisp, the images sharp, and I don't notice any blurring or choppiness from the 60hz refresh rates. Really an amazing value!

Reviews.Title: Bigger/Not Better
Reviews.Author: Cowgirl
Reviews.Content: I can see the screen well however, the picture is not clear.  The price was very affordable but the quality of the picture is not worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Litoxyhu
Reviews.Content: Nice, clear image in very good price!We love our new TV and we highly recommended to other shoppers...Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Great TV and for a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Stephen Hobbs
Reviews.Content: Saw this as a lightning deal the day BEFORE Thanksgiving for 169.99. I popped it in my cart and started thinking who would appreciate a TV for Christmas. The kids had an old CRT TV in their upstairs, so they won the toss!They are absolutely thrilled with all aspects of this TV. It looks great on their TV stand and has a terrific picture.From the responses we got for this gift, I would say it is a good value even at full price.

Reviews.Title: lightweight but gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Phil Da Agony
Reviews.Content: got it on sale during the holidays.it's pretty simple to figure out why these are cheap.boxes/frames are made out of cheap, light plastic.there's absolutely no weight to it. my 3 year old daughter could lift it if she wanted.but if all you care about the performance of it and you can look past the build, then this is for you.picture quality is absolutely great, and has built-in hd tuner that can be used with hd rabbit-ear, which was very important for me since i don't subscribe to any cable service.

Reviews.Title: Seiki SE46FY10
Reviews.Author: RONALD W. VARA
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV with good picture.  Lack of tint control and marginal audio volume only negative points at this time.(2 months service)

Reviews.Title: Happy, Happy, Happy
Reviews.Author: Leilani S. Fletcher
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased, kind of hard to hook up and still don't have it right, but I need to call someone,  Beautiful picture and we love it

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: BOO
Reviews.Content: We haven't been using it long as of yet. Just plugged it in Christmas,  but so far the tv is decent. The color coud be better as well as the sound but the kids are mostly playing x box...

Reviews.Title: Great Seiki TV
Reviews.Author: Carlos Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I super liked !!!!! .This is the Second same TV we buy for our Home. Incredible TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: It came in perfect condition and was shipped faster than expected. I am very happy with this TV and would suggest it to anyone who wanted a TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Sheila Nolan
Reviews.Content: I love this TV...good picture, easy set up and the price was a real bargain. Only down side is the sound quality...the rear facing speakers, while having decent range and decent sound quality, directs the sound back into the wall. Not really very practical for most peoples applications! A sound bar fixed the problem, but it took a lot of messing with, and I finally had to go on-line to an answer site to figure out how to make my Vizio soundbar work with this set ( Had to use the headphone jack, which means that now all of my sound goes through the soundbar, which is also not ideal, but better than before)All in all though, I'm impressed by the quality of everything else with this TV, and would recommend it to anyone looking for a lot of TV for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: WBurn
Reviews.Content: Have had and used this TV for a few weeks and really like it.  Great picture, good sound, and easy to use and set up.  Would buy again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Vivian LaFleur
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better TV for the price...clear picture, great sound, crystal clear...would buy it again and recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: This tv is great
Reviews.Author: Kelvin
Reviews.Content: Great tv! Looks amazing, sound is great. Got an amazing deal for black friday. Had it for a month now and nothing is wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Price!!
Reviews.Author: jon bledsoe
Reviews.Content: Really good TV for the price.  Got it the day before Thanksgiving and me and the whole family still like it a month later.

Reviews.Title: Update - audio input BROKE!  Nice picture and sound but...
Reviews.Author: babysue
Reviews.Content: Update March 2014.  Just plugged a cord into the coaxial digital audio out.  The input immediately BROKE.  And no tension was placed upon it AT ALL.  This is a cheaply made television.  Even though the picture is great, I can no longer recommend it because of this problem.  Very tempted to send it back.Received the set on December 6, 2013.  I have only had this set for two days.  But so far I am pleased.  The picture is great and so is the sound.  The only thing I should mention is the fact that the remote is a bit slow to respond.  But for the $349 I paid for the set I can certainly deal with that.  This is my first large LED HDTV so I can't compare it to others.  I can't say how long the set will last (some have complained that their sets have died).  But at least so far, I'm happy with this purchase.  Note that I am just using this set for over-the-air television stations, DVDs, and games...have not used it with cable.  Will update if any problems arise...

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: P. Hockings "zoso"
Reviews.Content: For a 170 bucks to your door it does what I expected it to do. Picture is not bad, obviously it is not a 600 dollar TV but good deal for what I paid for it on a Black Friday Flash Deal.

Reviews.Title: biggest bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: mb3581
Reviews.Content: **ORIGINAL REVIEW, SEE UPDATE BELOW**I will come back and update my review once I get a TV that's actually review-able.  I ordered the 50" for $229 the evening before Thanksgiving during the lightning deal sale.  It arrived Saturday morning via FedEx with a giant 'X' ripped in the side of the box.  I opened the package in front of the FedEx driver to inspect for damage and found the screen to be busted.  I didn't even remove it from the box to see how bad, I just ran my hand down the inside of the box across the screen and could feel the plastic gouged so I refused the shipment.I immediately jumped online to file for a replacement and was heartbroken when I found out that my only option was a refund since the unit was not in stock.  I waited til later in the day and tried again and was happy to see that I could then file for a replacement.  It arrived on Tuesday, double-boxed, in excellent condition.I pulled the new set out of the box, attached the stand, and turned it on to test it out and immediately found there to be a 4 or 5 inch line of dead pixels in the lower right side of the screen.  I have now filed for another replacement so hopefully by tomorrow I will have a fully functioning TV.Amazon's customer service is the best and easiest I've ever had to deal with so they get 5-stars for that.**UPDATE**I finally have a working 50" TV that I only paid $229 for.  I can't be happier with it.  This set is extremely bright and loud.  You can adjust the back light level if you are willing to edit the system menu if you think it's too bright.  I have not made any changes to the default color settings since it looks great out of the box.  I have it hooked up to a Roku in the bedroom, what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Value for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Lucius Maximus
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous when I purchased this TV on Amazon.  It was just too good of a deal to pass up.  After reading how many folks have cracked screens and so forth, I wasn't sure if I made the right decision.Boy, I'm glad that I got it.  This has to be the best deal ever, when you consider its value.  The design of the TV isn't really special but good enough.  The remote isn't especially responsive, and the image quality is just acceptable when you plug it in without adjustments.  BUT!  After proper calibrating the image quality (brightness, contrast, color, etc), this TV really shines for its price!  I've been watching blu-rays and playing PS3 games, and it's been great.  Oh, there are a couple of issues I discovered during calibration:1. Tint-  It's a bit on the red side.2.  Overscan-  you lose about at least 0.5-1 inch on all sides without zeroing overscan.Seiki doesn't make it easy for you to optimize your TV, and tint control is greyed out.  After you access the "service mode" and fix these issues, this TV looks really nice.  The only thing I'm still concerned about is the long term reliability, since Seiki isn't exactly a top brand.  Still, I'm very happy with the purchase right now.

Reviews.Title: Great tv for less
Reviews.Author: Raydarko
Reviews.Content: This tv has very vibrant colors. It's had led panel that matches samsung but without breaking bank.I love it

Reviews.Title: Good deal.
Reviews.Author: sung lee
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV from the lightning deal they offered on Amazon. The quality of the TV is very good and there were no scratches or dents and the picture was perfect. It's a good upgrade from my 32 inch TV.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Deal
Reviews.Author: ampersandrea
Reviews.Content: I will most likely update this in the future as I've only had a couple of hours with this product.First thing's first, this TV is nothing like the top brand LED TVs on the market right now. Really, you can't expect it to be for the price range. With that said, the TV is really nice!Picture Quality: It is bright! The picture looks crisp, and the colors vivid. Movies look great, but I have noticed it doesn't handle fast movement well. It's not so bad when watching a film, but if it's a cartoon (ie Adventure Time) it is obvious. It has this ghost effect that leaves an image of the previous frame for a split second. Even then, it's not a huge problem. Video games (360) have a similar effect, but like movies, it's not as bad/obvious. So far I've tested Skyrim, GTA 5, and FEZ. All of them look great!Sound Quality: This is why I'm giving it 4 stars. The sound quality is not so great. It's not terrible, but it's definitely not as good as the audio on the TV that we replaced. You can tamper with the settings to get it to sound better, but it does not help much. Don't let that sway you, though. It is something that you could get used to, and if you have a sound bar then there should be no worries. TIP: If you do end up getting a sound bar, make sure you have the proper connections. The only audio input that is dedicated for external speakers is a "coaxial" port. No optical input, unfortunately, but you can get an optical to coaxial adapter.Build Quality: It looks /really/ nice. It feels sleek and modern, and looks great mounted on the wall. Surprisingly, the TV itself is super light, a lot lighter than our old 32 in LCD. The glass stand is a nice touch, and looks really nice. Word of advice: If you do want to mount the TV on a wall using a mount you already have, you will probably need to get smaller or bigger bolts. The ones we used on our old TV were too big for this one, so we had to find smaller ones. We bought 10-24 x 1 sized bolts, but they didn't want to go in all the way, so a size down from that should do the trick. Still not sure the right size, since we happened to find ones that fit (with added washers).I still have a bit of testing to do (playing some BF3 on it) so I'll cut this review short. I will be back in a bout a week to update. Enjoy your new TV! (Seriously for $169 it is a steal)

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: this is a fantastic tv at a great price, it has a crisp picture and little or no glare.it was delivered on time and was easy to set up.very happy

Reviews.Title: Defective; Unreliable Customer Service; Warranty Nightmare
Reviews.Author: Carlos Coro
Reviews.Content: So I bought this TV for my own birthday during the HHGregg Memorial Day sale in 2013. I did a lot of research on this brand because frankly I had never heard of it. I read all these phenomenal reviews about how simple it was and how great the picture and sound quality were, so I was really excited when I picked it up from HHGregg. Out of the box the TV looked great, but when I hooked everything up the sound was not playing though the TV. After a hopeless conversation with Seiki's customer service, who insisted I just ship it back to them, and hours of research I discovered that I had to manually reset a setting on my cable box so that the Seiki could understand it.Not two weeks after the initial audio issue another problem occurred. The TV would randomly shut off only when it seemed like the least opportune time for it to shut off. Once again I called Seiki just for them to tell me that the TV was fine and that I should just turn off my DLC (dynamic light control). So I did, and sure enough the problem persisted. I really didn't want to deal with the hassle of shipping it back to Seiki so I decided to just put up with the random shut offs.After three grueling months of the aggravating shut offs I noticed a little black dot on the right hand side of the TV. I didn't think anything of it, and though that maybe it was just poor broadcasting. Sure enough it WASN'T and within a few days that black dot became a strip of dead pixels about inch long, and after days turned into weeks the inch long strip now reaches almost across the entire screen.At that point I had enough of this unreliable pesky TV so I called Seiki to make a claim on their One-Year warranty. This warranty would be great barring a few issues. First of all they want to send me a refurbished TV instead of a new one, and secondly they want ME to pay for the shipping! Shipping from Tallahassee, Fl to CALIFORNIA! The cheapest shipping option I could find was $180, which is practically HALF of what the TV cost me! There is NO WAY I'm paying $180 to get a refurbished TV to replace one that practically came broken.I've been calling them for hours at a time for about a week and I have yet to speak with someone personally. I've actually spent two hours on hold in total waiting for someone to at least answer. This is probably the most unprofessional company to work with. I've never been so dissatisfied with any product in my life. Thanks for the birthday gift Seiki, I would have appreciate a punch to the stomach instead of this HEADACHE.

Reviews.Title: Broken TV, non-existant customer support.
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived broken even though the packaging it was in was fine.  The screen would turn on but would not display anything other than a yellow-plaid pattern.  I tried calling their support guys twice and got hung up on both times.  I tried emailing them weeks ago and still have not heard back.  I'm not sure if they make cheap electronics inside which just got jostled in transit disrupting the display or if the TV was broken prior to leaving the warehouse but the fact remains that I got a broken TV from them and could not contact them to resolve the issue.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: Curtis Barker
Reviews.Content: Used as classroom TV/monitor works fine, light and easy to mount.  Used to replace 42" (relocated to secondary position) students have no problems viewing at 30-45 ft.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this TV!  :)
Reviews.Author: Ty
Reviews.Content: I got this TV because I gave my old tube TV to a friend, and it gave me the opportunity to save a paycheck or two to get this one.  Right now I use it for basic cable, PS3, PC games I use a controller with, and the PS4 in the future.  It's a great quality television for the price!  My only drawback is that this TV is not picking up any digital channels, while my brother's 32inch Vizio in his room is picking up 16, both televisions are splitting one cable, this maybe because my cable cord is over 20 feet and my brother's is maybe about 4 feet long, we're using custom cut coaxial cords.  But the standard definition cable quality is just fine for me!  All using the default settings, but plugged into a sound system through the 3.5mm headphones output.  This model doesn't have optical for audio, but it does have coaxial, so if you're looking for a sound system too, which I recommend as the speakers aren't very good for my taste, make sure it supports coaxial!  If you have a speaker system that only has optical, don't think you're outta luck as I'm pretty sure that converters exist!  :)

Reviews.Title: I have NEVER experienced WORSE customer service in my ife
Reviews.Author: Paul DeLucia
Reviews.Content: Ordered a Seiki product and after 9 months, the audio/visual ports stopped working. We contacted the company and after talking to a tech support rep, we instructed to ship it back to them (at our own expense) and they would ship us a new one because our malfunctioning unit was still under their "great" 1 year warranty.We shipped it to their location in Mississippi (at a personal cost of $120) We were initially instructed to email the tracking number to the rep we had originally spoken with to speed up the process of them shipping us the new one. We shipped out the originally TV on Nov. 20th.  We never received any confirmation that they had received the number or later the product until we called 2 weeks later. After being on hold for 30+min on several occasions (most times we were sent to voice-mail) we were told everything was in line to ship and to expect our new TV within 7-14 business days. After two more weeks, we called back. still no TV. we were told that they no longer made our model and we would have to wait until a refurbished model was available. Already having waited a month for this replacement, we refused to accept this and finally got a supervisor to approve an upgrade to the next size up. We have since been waiting for the replacement, approaching two months now. Every time we have called, we are told its waiting to be shipped or they are backed up and it will take up to 5 weeks to ship or their warehouse is out of stock. Every time a new story. We are out several hundred dollars between the initial purchase of this TV along with shipping it back. I would NEVER recommend anyone purchase anything from Seiki, they are incompetence and disregard for their customers incarnate.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the Money to me
Reviews.Author: I Just Shop Here
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV nothing fancy is not a smart TV but that's ok by me. I have a old PS3 and Wii hooked up to it so Ihave all the apps I need.47 inch was a perfect size for my mini Man cave err Den the pictures not bad you will not have near as many choices to adjust as with the higher model TV's but still enough to get a good quality picture from it.The TV also gets a plus for looking pretty good in its basic black. The stand is one of the lighter stands I have seen not sure if that's good or bad yet.PriceLooksSoundPicture A'sRemote C

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Martin
Reviews.Content: Tv gives beautiful  picture and sound it's easy to set up and needs no extras to set up.Great buy

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: cynstanley
Reviews.Content: I have had the tv since December and it was a good buy.  Glad I jumped on the opportunity to get it at a deep discounted price.

Reviews.Title: Black Friday deal Xmas 2013
Reviews.Author: JR Guerra
Reviews.Content: Got this TV on a Black Friday deal and didn't touch the box until Christmas Morning. Was nervous, of course, but so far the TV has been great. Pretty decent picture.Easy to set up. The Sound is pretty bad if you turn it up past 7..very schreechy, but since it's in my bedroom I rarely turn it up over 4. Sounds just fine. I fine tuned the color, in fact i still tweak to this day. Some channels look better than others, but for under 170 bucks, it was a good deal. Wouldn't make it my primary living room TV, i mean if you don't have a choice, you don't have a choice, but i'd buy another for under 170.00, fer sure.

Reviews.Title: A very nice TV for the money
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to beat this TV for the price.  It does not have the best picture in the world, but it is pretty good.  It makes a terriffic bedroom TV.  I am glad that I made this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Can't comment on the performance of this TV but the customer service was awesome
Reviews.Author: Deloris C.
Reviews.Content: When the tv arrived I didn't open it right away as I was still remodeling the space where it would sit.  When I did open it the TV was damaged which was surprising since the packaging showed no sign of damage.  Amazon worked with me and allowed me to returnthe TV  even though it was pass the time line for returns.  They gave me full credit so everything was resolved to my satisfaction.However, I would like to have been able to get another TV instead, because I doubt I will ever find another TV this size for this price

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: Cammie Adams
Reviews.Content: I never heard of this brand, but so far its been great for my back porchnice pic, poor sound

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: norah santana
Reviews.Content: We've had it for about 5 months and it has been working perfectly.Purchased on a lightning deal and the price was nonexistent!Great picture and good clear sound. The tv looks very nice and has a very sleek design.I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: LOVED IT TIL it DIED 5 months after we got it!!!
Reviews.Author: Sandy Chamblee
Reviews.Content: Picture is what u expect for the money...really a good deal.  WE THOUGHT!!!  5 months later it start turning off while watching it...then it starts 'scrambling' ....now nothing.  pout!

Reviews.Title: It's great.
Reviews.Author: Angela B.
Reviews.Content: Love the picture quality. The volume is very different from the other tvs but it is still great too. I would buy another one of this brand again.

Reviews.Title: Worth for the money...
Reviews.Author: alcappacino
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV on an Amazon lightning deal ($170 + taxes) and is worth the cost. I like the screen resolution, remote buttons for direct access (one cool feature is turning on captioning automatically on mute), slim size and lightweight, good speaker sound. Good as a backup, bedroom or guest room TV.However, it has a few drawbacks listed below to keep in mind during the purchase and depending on the price being paid.- Lacks lots of features including remembering Favorites once you power cycle (sometimes after its turned off)- Channel scanning is time consuming and the software keeps forgetting the channel list requiring you to rescan- One of screws on the stand didn't fit correctly and causes the stand to be a little unbalanced.- While browsing through the channel list, you cannot jump to a channel (unless you remember the channel number and type it) when you are scrolling as it needs to stop at each channel for the signal. This makes it very difficult to scroll to a channel which is farther below. This is applicable if you are using the TV directly or with an antenna without the set-top cable box.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: BrianH
Reviews.Content: Great TV at a great price. Very good picture, nice thin bezel and sleek design. Dish Network Remote quickly found a connection. Only reason I am giving 4 stars is the sound, the stock sound is very poor. Much worse than the Vizio it replaced. I had a soundbar so all was good, but you will probably want some other audio option if you buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Seiki 40inch TV
Reviews.Author: Christa Anderson
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying my Seiki TV so far.  I haven't had any problems with it yet. The Seiki brand is very affordable and I would recommend it to anybody who wants the same HD view as a Panasonic or Sony TV.  It has a pretty clear view for the price that I paid. I received it within 2-3 days of ordering it.

Reviews.Title: piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Rororiori "roro"
Reviews.Content: bought this tv brand new..the minute it turned it on...no sound no picture...had to return it..doesnt seem like a high quality item

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Mary Jo Fragale
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure about this TV before ordering it, but the price was great so I took a chance.The TV is a great size and the picture is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: surprisingly good quality
Reviews.Author: Michael Huang
Reviews.Content: bought this last black friday and I am pleasantly surprised at how good the pic quality of this tv is.I am using this as a monitor on my computer and so far I didn't experienced any bad things about it.

Reviews.Title: great tv great price!
Reviews.Author: Duzvicious
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for $300. its a great value!!! clear picture, light weight, easy to use. so far so good!

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed
Reviews.Author: Chance
Reviews.Content: I did not recognize the brand but bought it because of the ratings.  I have only had for a month- but I really think it is a GREAT deal!

Reviews.Title: Nice !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: James Hayner
Reviews.Content: Got this tv a few months ago on a lightning deal . I never do reviews but this 1 deserves it. I expected a fair  tv for the great price I got. I am very very pleased  !!!! Good looking light weight television  The picture is incredible .I put this in my 11 year old sons room and every time I go in there and see the picture I think about switching it with the expensive tv in the family room . Extremely impressed.

Reviews.Title: Best deal ever for $300!
Reviews.Author: CDizzie
Reviews.Content: To start off, I did not purchase this tv but the 47 inch that is the exact same, however since I can not find it on Amazon I'll just post my review here. I also did not purchase the tv on Amazon, but at walmart.com for $329. I will be completely honest, for that price, this is one of the greatest investments I've ever made. The TV came in good condition, not damaged, and the picture quality is damn good. The sound is clear but could be louder and the bass sucks at a high level. The controls are in depth and the tv is slim, and light.  It may not be as good as an LG or Samsung, but at half the price (For some, a third or more) I CAN NOT complain and I highly recommend the product. Now for the price here I would not have purchased it, but Sears and Kmart still have this TV in stock. It's a little higher priced at $379 but still a great deal! I'd get it while you can people...

Reviews.Title: Failure seiki screen TV 46 "
Reviews.Author: Jaicker Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Good afternoon, the seiki tv 46 "that has acquired a malfunction, turning on the TV screen presents a kind of fault (line) that does not go away. What is your recommendation on this?, Buy the product the last days month of November last year, but just comes coming to Venezuela this week. thanks

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: will guyot
Reviews.Content: we have had this tv for 4 months and love it... just plugged it in and got a new HD box and remote from our cable company and we have been happy ever since... great volume too.

Reviews.Title: 6 months and going
Reviews.Author: CeeCee3
Reviews.Content: Was satisfied with purchase and quality and sleek look.  HDTV looks great.  Sony Blue Ray and Google Chromecast hooked up with no problems.  Easy to do. The HDMI Cable previous purchased worked well with no problem.

Reviews.Title: Incredible for the price
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: It's essentially an off brand TV, so the picture is adequate, the sound is adequate, but it's got all the necessary ports and things, it's a huge pain to use, and is a 46" TV for $300!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Price - Bad TV
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV during a flash sale on near Black Friday for only $200 so I knew I was probably getting a pretty crumby TV... that being said, I would not recommend getting this TV at full price.I already have a few pixels that have gone dead. The colors are quite distorted. The first one I got was DOA.

Reviews.Title: line on screen and ared line running down the of the screen
Reviews.Author: Julius Hall
Reviews.Content: This tv is a peice of junk I tried everything to get the line fron jumping up and down the screen

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Risa Klee
Reviews.Content: Once we got help from the cable guy with the settings, this a beautiful picture, especially for watching sports and movies. It's lightweight and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: Nice price; limited audio output
Reviews.Author: Ninja Warrior
Reviews.Content: Got this at a reduced price. The picture is fantastic, the sound is not. My understanding is that that is to be expected for modern flat screen television sets.My biggest beef is that I cannot connect R-L audio output cables to the TV. It has only optical digital audio or stereo headphone plug-ins in the back, which makes connection to a sound bar very difficult.

Reviews.Title: Not trash, but not good.
Reviews.Author: Reviewer
Reviews.Content: This set did not have good color reproduction, viewing angle or sound. I ended up selling my unit shortly after purchase. I should also mention I bought this when it was on sale for $230, so for the current price of $600+ you shouldn't even be looking at this.

Reviews.Title: highly recommend
Reviews.Author: nicole jones
Reviews.Content: Perfect size.  Very good picture.  Easy to set up.  Exactly what we were looking for!  Very light weight.  Right price.

Reviews.Title: like it but a little fuzzy - then again i haven't dug into instructions
Reviews.Author: Joe E. Haley
Reviews.Content: nice TV, but a little fuzzy,i can't figure out how to sharpen TV - this could be user error! overall ok

Reviews.Title: For Thanksgiving Sale price, it's not bad
Reviews.Author: silk
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is not as my 7 year old Panasonic plasma.  But hey, you get what you pay for.  There is also a dead pixel or two, clearly a budget TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Ryan S.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about except for the sound. It's a bit weak but that's because the tv is so thin. I recommend a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Patch of Dead Pixels
Reviews.Author: J. McCrary
Reviews.Content: I purchased this, with probably 90% of others on Black Friday and I was so excited to get it! This has the specs I wanted, it's a decent brand, and it looked to have a nice panel in it as well. After getting the TV all setup and ready to use I fired up my Xbox One on it, and saw a horrible patch of dead pixels about 2" x 1" with jagged edges.I was distraught, I wanted to get a replacement but the permanent roommate wanted to just get the money back. She ended up winning that discussion, so it got sent back to the Amazon jungle. I wanted it to work and to be happy with it, but I seemed to draw the short stick on this one.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Cyndi E
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty great for the price.  The picture is great actually, and the sound is good.  I've got a Chromecast hooked up to it, and the USB connection on the back works to power it.  I was surprised by how light this TV is.  The 32 inch LCD this replaced was only a few years old bet it was heavier!  If you spend a little time making adjustments to the picture, you can get a great TV at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at great price
Reviews.Author: Shinnu
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for $170 on Black Friday and it is absolute bang for the buck. Great pictures with 3 hdmi inputs.

Reviews.Title: it a good tv with cable tv
Reviews.Author: Jesus
Reviews.Content: it was only 168 in black friday. is a good tv and family uses it to watch movies and play games.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: junaed
Reviews.Content: Got the 50 inch from black friday deal. No complains so far. Sound needed some adjustment, but overall happy. Works great with the chromecast.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Quality
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: This TV has one of the best pictures I have ever seen. It is the perfect size for my bedroom wall, lightweight, barely uses any electricity and it doesn't have any humming to keep me up at night.

Reviews.Title: Black Friday rock on!
Reviews.Author: Jc
Reviews.Content: Amazing how light this thing was... I have a small business and when I do presentations at shows this really suits the need. light weight and easy to setup. Great color and sound, I use it as slideshow presenter while in my booths.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Bradley Billig
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon they said it was slighly used and may have a small scratch on the top les than 1/4" the viewing screen undamaged.  When I unpacked the TV it looked like it was still in the factory protective covers and came with everything to enclude batteries for the remote.  The picture is great and I got this item at almost half off the orginal cost and with the Amazon A-Z Guarantee it was the best purchase over a new TV.

Reviews.Title: for the money......
Reviews.Author: rb
Reviews.Content: its great!!!requires some dialing in,but when that is done,it is ,in my opinion,one of the very best bang for the buck items(by far) out there.if you have no patience,this is not for you,go get a tat or something,but if you want to go through the menu,mess with everything for a little while,its almost a sony,sort of like life,you get out what you put in.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: jessye Ashley
Reviews.Content: Ok for the price and perfect for teenager or younger child. Quality not as great as other brands but it is good

Reviews.Title: Good design and performance at a great price
Reviews.Author: Too many books, not enough time
Reviews.Content: Nice HDTV at a great price.As usual, picture out of the box is poor. A little adjustment and it's fine.I have it mounted in my kitchen and the picture is more than adequate for TV shows, news, etc.. I'm not sure that I'd be thrilled if it were my primary TV for movies, but even so, I don't think it would be terrible.Tuner pulls in more stations than most.Sound is decent, and volume is great.Great assortment of inputs.Remote is strangely laid out (channels on left, volume on right) and hard to figure out in the dark. But it works quite well.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRICE! Wonderful TV!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth "wealth of useless information"
Reviews.Content: This TV serves all the needs that a straightforward TV  needs to have. The price was fantastic on a special gold buy.  I wasn't looking for one this big, but couldn't have purchased a smaller one for the same money. The reviews were preyty darn good, and trust them...I am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Jack Gibson
Reviews.Content: Excellent tv, especially for the price I got it for. Good size, quality, and easy to use. I definitely recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Picture
Reviews.Author: Susan R. Murray
Reviews.Content: The Seiki was recommended by a "cable guy" who had bought one. I ordered one for myself and one for a Christmas gift. Everyone in the family is happy with the clarity of the picture. I was extremely pleased with the price when compared to similar units. Both TVs have been in use since Christmas.

Reviews.Title: GREAT basic TV!
Reviews.Author: Nabeel
Reviews.Content: Alright so after much research and consideration, I finally decided to buy this TV. I got it brand new from someone on Craigslist ($250!!!). This TV is fantastic for a basic living room setup. I use it as an external monitor for Netflix and other videos playing from my MacbookPro. I was actually looking at more prominent brands like Samsung and LG but I just couldn't pull the trigger on those price tags.I cannot comment on quality with actual cable or satellite TV because I don't have either. I use it exclusively with my MBP. So the quality is directly related to the originating video. Any HD video is absolutely beautiful, no pixelation whatsoever. Lesser quality videos like 360 will reflect pixelation but it also shows up on my MBP so it has nothing to do with the tv.
